chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Hope M Penley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
04/27/2015 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS EARLY DISCHARGE FROM SUPERVISION.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid within the first 90 days of probation. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold as its primary business.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must continue mental health therapy including medication regimen.
Must give face-to-face apology to the officer within the first 30 days of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hope M Penley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4/15/15 Letter to Judge Boyle from Department of Corrections with early discharge recommendation.

Defendant Hope M Penley in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement recited.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 1 is Dismissed and Read In.  State relates.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence
30 days jail - Work release granted - STAYED

1 year Probation
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold as its primary business
Must continue mental health therapy including medication regimen
Must give face-to-face apology to the officer within first 30 days of Probation
Court costs to be paid within first 90 days

Defendant Hope M Penley in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over - Information filed - Formal reading waived - Defendant stands mute and Court enters not guilty plea - Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Defendant Hope M Penley in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Defendant Hope M Penley in custody.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 11:45 am.
